alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Harnett; Hoke; Lee; Moore; Scotland (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 1:39PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Moore, northeastern Scotland, Harnett, northwestern Cumberland, south central Lee and Hoke Counties through 230 PM EDT... At 139 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles east of Southern Pines to 10 miles southwest of Raeford. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fayetteville, Southern Pines, Raeford, Lillington, Fort Bragg, Pinehurst, Dunn, Aberdeen, Pope AFB and Hope Mills. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for central North Carolina.

area.areaDesc: Cumberland; Harnett; Hoke; Lee; Moore; Scotland
